Jargon Term: large heart attack in the back side of your heart
stent placed in one of the arteries bringing blood to your heart

Annotation: Medical Issues - Complication developed in the hospital

Jargon Term: In order to keep this stent open you will be on several new medications and stop smoking. These interventions are critical as reobstructing your stent would be very dangerous.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: You will need to watch carefully for lightheadedness, dizziness, back or groin pain and any other concerning symptoms
If any of these occur, please call Dr [**Last Name (STitle) 171**] or return to the hospital immediately.
Please review the attached list of medications and take everything as prescribed.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: You will need for follow up with your primary doctor [**First Name (Titles) **] [**Last Name (Titles) 766**] to have your blood pressure and blood counts checked.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - PCP appointment

Jargon Term: You will also need to see Dr [**Last Name (STitle) 171**] (cardiology) in 2 weeks as written below.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment

Jargon Term: You can return to work in 1 week but be sure not to do any lifting.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: After you see Dr [**Last Name (STitle) 171**], you can discuss gradually increasing your activity and exercise.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment
